alerts.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:43AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
alerts.description:
At 943 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from 8 miles west of Terral to 4 miles northeast of
Olney. Movement was southeast at 45 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is
possible.

Locations impacted include...
Henrietta, Archer City, Petrolia, Scotland, Windthorst, Bellevue,
Jolly, Lake Arrowhead, Bluegrove, Newport, Shannon, Joy, and Vashti.

alerts.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 8:24AM CDT until June 15 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive
rainfall is expected.

* WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following
counties, Cooke and Montague.

* WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT.

* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
Some low-water crossings may become impassable.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This
will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying
and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in
the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have
fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are
forecast.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Gainesville, Bowie, Nocona, Muenster, St. Jo, Lindsay,
Callisburg, Lake Muenster, Hubert H Moss Lake, Lake Nocona,
Sunset, Lake Amon G Carter, Lake Kiowa, Ray Roberts Park
Johnson Branch, Lake Texoma, Road Runner, Valley View, Nocona
Hills, Montague and Oak Ridge.
